comment: YOU HAVE TO JUST MAKE SURE THAT YOU PAY ATTENTION TO THE DATES AND PARTICIPATE. I DID IT ONLINE, SO YOU HAD TO MAKE SURE YOU ARE GIVING THOROUGH RESPONSES IN ONLINE DISCUSSIONS. GREAT TEACHER AND THE CLASS IS NOT DIFFICULT.

Her classwork honestly isn't too tough except for one assignment. Weekly discussions and quizzes which are very boring. She'll pull a current event into the mix at one point. The toughest part of the class is the theory application paper which to be quite frank, she is absurd with her grading. She acts like we are English majors and is snarky.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Took Professor McMahon-Howard for Victimology and she was great! Very passionate about the topics and she brings in guest speakers every now and then. You will need to read for the tests and she does not post the slides online to take good notes and you'll be fine. Group project final that included a 10-12 page paper and a presentation
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Her assignments are all hidden inside folder after folder after folder. If you do not read the syllabus thoroughly, you will miss how to find the assignments. Assignments and quizzes are easy if you do them. Tests are decent (not too tough not too easy). Theory paper is HARD! She does not help you if you have a borderline grade no matter what.

I took Dr. McMahon-Howard online this past semester (Fall 2016) for Criminology and was not looking forward to the class. However, she made the class bearable by being understanding, clear about deadlines/grading and responds to emails in a timely manner. The class is not hard at all if you do the work. One of the sweetest professors! TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: TAKE HER TAKE HER TAKE HER . took her for criminology and she is amazing! even though this is a upper class, it is easy. just read, study for the tests, do the quizzes,and participate in discussions in class. end of year paper that was not to hard. very understanding and helpful. i received an A

I took this class in a summer semester and it was very time consuming. There are quizzes and two discussion posts due every day, Monday through Friday. There are two tests and a long research paper. This class takes over your life because of the amount of reading needed to complete the daily work. She is a tough grader, so follow directions!!

Class went the full 75m, involved copying powerpoint slides with occasional videos. She's going to do online reading quizzes next semester. Grade distribution: 6% participation, 15% 3-5 pg paper, 15% in class debate, 3 exams 20% ea, 4% quizzes. Exams were scantron and short answer mostly from notes. If you follow her instructions you will do fine.

The class involved participation (10%), 2 exams (30% each), and a research paper (30%). Attendance was mandatory. Exams were mostly from powerpoint slides we copied down in class. She's passionate about the class. If you properly satisfy all her paper requirements then expect an A. No mysteries. Exams are multiple choice scantron and short answer.

Attendance it part of the grade, if you dont miss class you get extra point on your final grade. Gives super helpful study guides. No homework except reading and extra credit for each test. If you come to class, take notes and study, it is an easy A. There is one paper and she is very clear on instructions.

Dr. McMahon-Howard has done a great job putting together her online class. She has interesting discussion posts and assignments. There is a weekly quiz, 10 questions, that come directly from the book, weekly discussion posts, a midterm and final and two papers. You will definitely need the book.

Dr. McMahon-Howard is an amazing teacher! She is incredibly helpful and patient, plus she is so passionate about what she does that you can't help but take an interest in the learning material! The tests were super straight-forward, very heavily based on notes with a little reading thrown in occasionally. She makes succeeding in the class easy!

She is one of the best teachers I had here. I went into her class thinking I was going to hate it because it had nothing to do with my major, but she made me love it! Open book online quizzes every week, 3 tests and an optional final! She LOVES what she does so she really is an awesome teacher and really tries to help everyone!

Dr. Howard was my professor for a 4 week summer sociology class. She makes the class very interesting and relatable and her tests are straight forward from the notes. If you go to class and study the notes, this class is an easy A.

Great class!  Really enjoyed it!!! Dr McMahon-Howard is really excited about teaching and she's got really great energy.  She's very helpful when you ask questions for guidance with papers, etc.  Grades are NOT a mystery so show up, take close notes-- the book is really just a side-aid (in 2 wk Maymester at least) and you'll do fine.

Took her for the Criminology Mini-mester. First time teaching it and she was great. I'm a psych major and this class totally made me interested in CJ. Definitely makes class interesting and her tests are fair. Group work wasn't as bad as I anticipated. I recommend taking the minimester with her!

This Girl is on FIRE! Loved this minimester course.  Dr McMahon-Howard teaches from her heart and encourages use of real world examples; which serves as a great tool to retain the material. Take her if you can!

I took her as a maymester and LOVED her class, as well as her as a person and a professor. Her tests are straight-foward and the debates are interesting. Made an A in her class, and would take her again if I could.

Good teacher but is a hard grader. I made a C in her class because she said I text in her class but she never asked anyone not too! I would avoid. Will not ever take again and will ignore her in the hallway.

Class was online. Lots of discussions and research this and that type posts. Two 4-5 question essay exams. Two writing assignments on articles. Her grading is sporadic to say the least, sometimes you can get an 100 and the next a 60, for the same effort. I'd avoid if you can. But better to take online Criminology than her class, with presentations.

Horrid teacher. Very nit picky. Expects you to do everything to every little letter, and if you miss one thing she will take off big time. Her grading scale was worth more for her opinion responses than it was for quizzes which took 2 hours each. This is for the online class. I'm guessing her other classes are alike.

Awesome professor! Take her if you can. Criminology (and Victimology) were both GREAT classes! You learn a ton and find it very useful! Debates were a lot of fun as well... a great way to learn and retain material. Debates also help in applying theory

Awesome. Had her before she is interesting,knows her stuff and tests on notes heavily and readings. SHOW UP for class,participate in class discussions do any extra credit offered. You should do well. Love her classes. great lectures. Favorite class of the semester.
Professor McMahon is a fantastic professor. She makes Criminal Justice extremely easy and interesting. I'm looking forward to Criminology with her as well.

Dr. McMahon-Howard is a WONDERFUL professor!  She challenges the class to think, but still explains the material clearly.  Tests are Mult Choice, T/F, and short answer and are easy as long as you attend class and participate in discussions.  If you get the chance DEFINITELY TAKE HER!  She's so awesome! One of my favs!
I had Prof Mcmahon Howard for the intro cj class. She is very enthusiastic in her teaching style. I look forward to my next class with her, her favorite, Victimology.

Dr. McMahon-Howard ROCKS! I wish every prof in college was like her. She challenges you to think and makes class interesting and fun. Really relates to students and does a great job making the material "stick" through class discussions. Take her-you will not regret it!

Outstanding Professor! You will learn a lot from her--she is always available and helps any way she can.  She is very fair and offers extra credit.  She makes class fun by incorporating the course material into lively conversations--she keeps you on your toes--but she is a lot of fun. One good way to stay on her good side is to READ YOUR TEXT!!!
